verse: When David had passed a short way ·over the top of the Mount of Olives [beyond the summit], Ziba, Mephibosheth’s [Jonathan’s son and Saul’s grandson; 4:4] servant, met him. The king asked, “Where is ·Mephibosheth [your master’s son/grandson]?”

As King David came to Bahurim, a man came out ·and cursed him [cursing at them]. He was from ·Saul’s family group [the clan of the house of Saul], and his name was Shimei son of Gera.
He threw stones at David and his ·officers [officials; servants], but the people and soldiers gathered ·all around David [to his right and left].
Shimei cursed David, saying, “Get out, get out, you ·murderer [man of blood], you ·troublemaker [scoundrel].

Abishai son of Zeruiah said to the king, “Why should this dead dog curse you, the king? Let me go over and cut off his head!”

But the king answered, “·This does not concern you [What have I to do with you], sons of Zeruiah! If ·he is cursing me because the Lord told him to [the Lord has told him, “Curse David”] , who can ·question him [say, “Why have you done so”]?”

David also said to Abishai and all his ·officers [officials; servants], “My own ·son [flesh and blood] is trying to kill me! ·This man is a Benjaminite and has more right to kill me [How much more reason has this Benjaminite; as a member of Saul’s clan]! So David and his men went on down the road, ·but [while] Shimei ·followed [went along] on the nearby hillside. He kept cursing David and throwing stones and ·dirt [flinging dust] at him.

Meanwhile, Absalom, Ahithophel, and all the ·Israelites [people/army of Israel] arrived at Jerusalem.
David’s friend Hushai the Arkite came to Absalom and said to him, “Long live the king! Long live the king!”
Absalom asked, “·Why are you not loyal [Is this the love/loyalty you show] to your friend David? Why didn’t you leave Jerusalem with your friend?”
Hushai said, “I belong to the one chosen by the Lord and by these people and everyone in Israel. I will stay with ·you [him].
In the past I served your father. So whom should I serve now? David’s son! I will serve you as I served him.”
Absalom said to Ahithophel, “·Tell [Advise; Counsel] us what we should do.”
